messages.message: Nope, we don’t support user deletion. can you make another account with the correct email? We can deactivate the gmail one if you’d like
I need the username unfortunately to map my s3 bucket properly
how does the username map to the s3 bucket? The only way is to directly go into the database and update the email there.
I use the same bucket across all instances. Same path to keep everything intact
I can switch between dog food prod sandbox all on the same s3 to access ibresults etc
ah got it, for the repo-owner path. yeah, you’lll have to directly make a DB change. Which sandbox is it, do you have access to the DB?
I can use my gmail email if it’s a big lift. I’ll be tearing this sandbox down on Tuesday anyways

Probably not worth it then. There’ll be a little bit of spelunking to try to pull out the DB connection details. Do you have kubectl access? You’ll have to look for the connection string in core-platform-service, then use that to mount the DB into the Subspace, then you can run the query.
Okay. If I get creative tonight I’ll tackle that. Thanks for the guidance
Any reason we don’t support user deletion?

Because it’s very messy from the data-retention perspective. What happens to all their repos/files, or published marketplace packages? Who owns that data, the company, or the user themselves? Things like audit logs or metrics would still need to be able to reference this deleted user, so we have to make sure to not fully purge them. But to do that, we have to disallow re-use of the same username or email, otherwise the logs become inaccurate/ambiguous
Makes sense. Thanks for the details
